column5: Jungle Gardens is a 170 acre self-guided swamp and garden tour located next to the Tabasco factory on Avery Island. It features a 900-year-old Buddha statue, a snowy white egret habitat called Bird City, and plenty of other local wildlife and exotic botanical specimens from around the world.Founded by Edward McIlhenny, Jungle Gardens was created originally as a private bird sanctuary on his estate. In 1935 McIlhenny opened it to the public.
column6: A swamp and garden tour featuring local wildlife and exotic botanical specimens from around the world.Â
